Texts.Chs: 叶族人希望迈克能工作。。。
当你在每句台词前向听众表达你的怀疑时，好的演讲就不那么容易了。
Texts.Eng: Good speeches aren't so easy to make when you voice your doubt before every sentence to the audience.

Texts.Chs: 我必须仔细考虑我在这里所说的话的影响。
Texts.Eng: I must think carefully about the impact of my words here.

Texts.Chs: 我想做一个演讲，也许有一天会让世界变得更好。
Texts.Eng: I'd like to make a speech that might change the world for the better someday.

Texts.Chs: 我想在开场白中说，我完全不知道我在说什么，无论何时何地。
Texts.Eng: I'd like to preface by saying I have absolutely NO idea what it is I'm talking about, ever, at any time.
Speeches ain't exactly my strong suit.

Texts.Chs: 最好的和最差的人都在这样的讲台上留下了自己的印记。
Texts.Eng: The best and worst of people have all made their mark atop podiums like these.

Texts.Chs: 是时候让别人听到你的声音了！
Texts.Eng: Time to make your voice heard!
